title: Isolating the Variable
text: First, we need to move the constant term to the other side by adding both sides by 5: $$x^2-3x=5$$.
speech: First, we need to move the constant term to the other side by adding both sides by 5: , x squared minus 3 x is equal to 5 .

title: Completing the Square
text: Now, we can take our $$b$$ term and find the value we need to complete the square. $$\frac{\left(-3\right)}{2}=\left(-\frac{3}{2}\right)$$. Then, $${\left(-\frac{3}{2}\right)}^2=\frac{9}{4}$$.
speech: Now, we can take our  b  term and find the value we need to complete the square. , fraction, negative 3, over 2,  is equal to negative 3 halves . Then, , parentheses negative 3 halves  squared is equal to 9 fourths .

title: Completing the Square
text: Here, we can add $$\frac{9}{4}$$ to both sides of the equation: $$x^2-3x+\frac{9}{4}=5+\frac{9}{4}$$.
speech: Here, we can add  9 fourths  to both sides of the equation:  x squared, minus 3 x plus 9 fourths is equal to, 5 plus 9 fourths .

title: Factoring
text: Finally, we can simplify and factor: $${\left(x-\frac{3}{2}\right)}^2=\frac{29}{4}$$.
speech: Finally, we can simplify and factor:  parentheses, x minus 3 halves,  squared is equal to 29 over 4 .

title: Square Root
text: We now take the square root of both sides: $$x-\frac{3}{2}=\left(+plusminus\right)+\frac{\sqrt{29}}{2}$$.
speech: We now take the square root of both sides:  x minus 3 halves, is equal to parentheses positive plusminus  plus, fraction, the square root of 29 over 2,  .

title: Simplify the Expression
text: The last step is to add $$\frac{3}{2}$$ to both sides, so the answers are $$\frac{3+\sqrt{29}}{2}$$ and $$\frac{3-\sqrt{29}}{2}$$.
speech: The last step is to add  3 halves  to both sides, so the answers are  fraction, 3 plus the square root of 29 over 2,   and  fraction, 3 minus the square root of 29 over 2,  .
